intro: Barleria sacanii, commonly known as the Natal barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its showy, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple and appear in clusters during the warmer months. Barleria sacanii is well adapted to dry conditions and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
